website_summaries.verdict: Both regular gym-goers and dedicated CrossFitters marvel at the performance of the Inov-8 F-Lite 235 v3. The shoe is said to handle anything you throw at it in the gym, from box jumps and squats to rope climbs and treadmill. Its extremely lightweight and flexible construction make it stand out from the other trainers on the market.
pros: Lots of positive feedback has been given to the comfortable fit of the trainer
It’s been generally described as stable for squats and deadlifts
The 235 v3 is considered one of the lightest and most flexible models on the market of training shoes
It makes the shoe perfect for agility drills and short runs
The updated Powerflow+ midsole has received a number of compliments for giving ample cushioning during high-impact exercises
Multiple wearers have lauded the efficient grip on the outsole
The RopeTec protection has performed admirably during rope climbs, according to a good number of reviews
Most users find the overall construction of the shoe to be well-made and durable
The streamlined style and conservative color options have delighted many purchasers
cons: Several experts emphasize that given the shoe’s flexible design, it may not be a good option for those who need sturdy support for heavy lifts

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to the same as the F lite 235 v1
customer_reviews.text: Inov-8 took the best shoe in the history of the Earth (the F lite 235v1) and...completely ruined it. This shoe is substantially narrowed than the v1, both in the toe box and the heel. It's stiff, and it feels like a running shoe. Not good if what you want is something like the F lite 235 v1. This really shouldn't be considered the same shoe. Build quality and appearance is great, so I don't want my disappointment to sway your buying, just understand that this IS NOT EVEN CLOSE to the F lite 235 v1. Otherwise probably a great show for other people.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: liking these, read for sizing info for big feet
customer_reviews.text: i wear a 13w in most tennis shoes. boots very, however big name hiking boots are typically a 14w. i bought the 13 because there was no wide. length was perfect but just a tad tight. so i sent back for 14 with a quick turn around. width is perfect but it is a hair to long. hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Shammer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite training shoe to date
customer_reviews.text: These have quietly been my favorite training shoes, so far. I'm a firefighter and do a mix of powerlifting and cross-training, and I would choose these over all the Nike zero-drop heels and Adidas trainers of my workouts past. If you have a longer run scheduled in for your workouts, I would suggest trying a shoe with more cushion/support throughout, but the INOV-8 235 v3 has held up to 6-days-a-week workouts consisting of 45mins of high-intensity jump ropes, rowing, and general kettlebell madness and traditional powerlifting. Super-breathable and supportive for the heavier lifts, despite the tops sitting below the ankle. Highly recommended if this is your first zero-drop heel!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes to have a flexible yet supportive enough shoe. I love em. They are so comfortable its unreal. You can almost curl your toes and bend the shoe at the same time. I love them for airplanes too as you can move your toes around much more than other sneakers. The quality seems fantastic. Not one slight sign of wear. I wear them like all day now too, not just at the gym. I like to squat and deadlift in them much more than other shoes
customer_reviews.author: ryguy

customer_reviews.title: Best Training Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing training shoes! I have been using inov-8 training shoes in the gym for 4 years and would never use any other brand. They hold up to anything you throw at them whether it’s rope climbs, box jumps, or just a neutral palate form for squatting. While i don’t recommend running a 5k in them I do use them to run out a mile in between sets and they do the job! Highly recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Workout Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Tried a few others (Adidas, Reebok) and they are all too narrow. I have a wide-ish 13 and these fit perfect. Nice and light, but very stable for squats, etc. Completely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: mikeh

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for Crossfit, but stop messing with the fit!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time user of inov-8 shoes starting with the flite 230's (the original blue ones). Still love the shoes but 2 things to note: 1. The widened toe box gives too much wiggle room for the foot which ironically creates a sense of instability 2. I personally do NOT like the asymmetric shape of the shoes they've migrated to. The feel of the shoes continues to be great.
customer_reviews.author: Eggs

customer_reviews.title: Too Small and Cramped in the Toe
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer claims the toe bed is wide and roomy in their shoes. I'm tall and my feet are long and narrow, not wide. And yet, I found the toe area very tight and cramped. I went up a half size beyond my regular size. That pair was too tight also. I shouldn't have to go up a full size in a shoe to get a good fit. I went back to years old pros Nike and Adidas.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paige

customer_reviews.title: Good for a typical CF workout
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Inov-8 Mens F-Lite 235 V3. They fit good. a very snug fit, which for me is good. Good support for metcon multiple rep stuff like power snatches, clean & jerks and push press while at the same time working well to do all the stuff in-between like row, run, box jump, burpees. I will say for me, not a distance running shoe. Feels good 200m-400m, not so good for longer distances. With that being said, I am one of those people with a big body.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kent

customer_reviews.title: Wore once, Scuffs easily
customer_reviews.text: I got the white shoe and find the shoe comfortable, fits well. But after one wear, I already have once scuff/stain, which won't come off. Annoyed the shoe maker can't make a finish more resilient to scuffs and stains. Perhaps the shoemaker can let me know how to rectify the scuff.
customer_reviews.author: DEC

customer_reviews.title: Stable but a little wide in the toes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had these for a few workouts - so far so good. I definitely feel more stable in squats than I did with my running shoes. The shoes fit fairly true to size, but the “toe box” is a little wide so while my feet don’t slide in them at all (good lacing) there is plenty of room in the front.
customer_reviews.author: John P Horning

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy, super sturdy, great fit, great for short jogs/runs, and great for heavy lifting. Once you break them in a little bit, they fit just amazing. (For me anyways) Very lightweight shoes, I wouldn't compare them to socks like some have, but as far as shoes go they are the most comfy I have ever had, short of flip flops.
customer_reviews.author: John Martin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good one big flaw
customer_reviews.text: These are a good stable shoe for most gym activities however the rigid plastic on the inside presses into the arch of my foot and is very uncomfortable. I have worked the shoe with my hands to try and get the plastic to lay flatter but it is a bit of an annoying flaw for a pricier shoe.
customer_reviews.author: S*M*C

customer_reviews.title: Size is exact, recommend + 1⁄2 size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes spacifically because they are White and because Altra doesn't have a true white shoe. These innov8"s have decent toe-box though they are smaller than Altras. They fit true to size which leaves my long toe tapping the end of the 10 1⁄2 shoe which I don't like. See photos. I am diabetic and prefer a wide toe-box so my toes can splay. Yes, I would buy these again, just 1⁄2 size bigger. They feel great and look good too with bluejeans and a tshirt.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ramos

customer_reviews.title: I expected more for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'll update on how well the hold up later but they are not comfortable, have no support and feel like they won't last long. Update: One week in and I hate them. Most uncomfortable athletic shoe I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Boots

customer_reviews.title: Buy these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these shoes. Bought them for CrossFit. They are light weight, comfortable, and are breaking in well. An actual fair price which is refreshing. You can pay $40+ Just for the Reebok CrossFit logo and designation which is a rip off. Get them now set the trend because soon everyone will have them.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great crosstraining shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Fits as expected but has a roomy toe box. Can be used for weightlifting and running fine. Working to break the shoe in and we'll see how much better they are. They feel very lightweight. Weighed in at 10oz.
customer_reviews.author: byron

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit as expected. They are comfortable even without socks. I have yet to put them to the strenuous test of running and crossfit - hopefully after the pandemic. So far, they are great for the workouts I do at home.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gym/HIIT Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Not the best for running, but overall - a tremendously comfortable, flexible, attractive circuit training shoe. Great for leg work (squats) and HIIT exercises. Planning to purchase a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Worse F-Lite Versions made YET
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how this is even considered F-LITE compared to previous versions of the shoe. I think coronavirus has taken a toll on the F-LITEs because this new version has gained weight and is not as slim as the previous version. Maybe inov8 will learn, probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Mashal

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a previous pair of Inov8's and loved them. Thought I would get the same comfort with these. But I was wrong. They make you feel like you're walking around over pronated.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Better than the V2
customer_reviews.text: Fit my husband's very wide foot well. He wears them for all kinds of workouts. Says they are way better than the F-lite 235 V2.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the Inov-8 line and usually get the 235, I had issue with the previous versions with seams bursting or the sole shifting too much but the V3 is perfect so far. I use it for everything. Lifting, running short distances, and just general wear. Great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfort is outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the fit and comfort is even better than first thought of after reading the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Size 15 winner!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE go-to CrossFit show for men size 15. Reebok abandoned us and I just don’t like the Nike Metcons. These are lighter than my Nano 2.0s. Flexible. Grippy. Great all around shoe.
customer_reviews.author: ABF

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: Great cross training shoe, fit as expected. Great support for lifting but light and flexible as well. Happy purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AJF

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to workout in and instead wear them with jeans. They look really nice and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi Viking

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised. Shipped and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Shipped and arrived on time. Comfortable, great support. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had them very long but I like them so far. My only complaint is most shoes nowadays have worthless, paper thin insoles. So I got some Superfeet insoles and now they’re good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Great gym shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome shoes for working out, especially functional training and crossfit style workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Soles fall apart like a cheap Chinese product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed spent 130 dollars on product and the soles are falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: robert p gallo

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: The color and size was as expected. I'm happy with the fit and the look.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for HIIT!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for gym HIIT type workouts. Love them. They do seem to run like 1/2 size small.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Sixx

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: At the recommendation of some fellow crossfitters, I broke down and bought a pair of these trainers, and I am much more stable with weightlifting than I was in running shoes
customer_reviews.author: Justin L.

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight cross trainers and can be used for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: G. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great cross-training shoe
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband, who only wore nanos before. He has worn the Inov-8 shoes every workout since he got them and says they are the most comfortable shoe. Great for lifting and high intensity workouts!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great CF Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I have used this for a number of WODs, but still haven't tested under heavy weights. The 4mm drop is what you would expect from this type of shoe and the roomy toe box is also a positive. Fits true to size (used the same size that I use for my Nano's and NOBulls).
customer_reviews.author: MJK

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Heel way to narrow. Can feel corners of sole through the heels. Traction is good. Difficult to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Verified purchase

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe for functional fitness training
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. The version 3 is an upgrade from my older ones. Not as flat as the previous version. Comfortable enough to workout 6 days a week with
customer_reviews.author: EZ6102

customer_reviews.title: So fresh and so clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm an inov-8 fan boy and this is the best looking shoe they have released. They fit my wide feet perfectly and are great for all workouts. I still can't get over how clean crisp they look.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shroff

customer_reviews.title: Size & Design
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them because the rating was 5/5 for width! They are not wide at all... my foot hurt when I put them on! I did love the design.... if they came in 2E I would order them again!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tacher

customer_reviews.title: This Is Not A Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The first pair had to be returned because they were too small; not too disappointing, because depending on the type and brand, I wear 12-15. Recommend ordering same size as your running shoe. Provides a stable platform for weight lifting and rowing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Don Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Total foot support
customer_reviews.text: Had been using Head and Sketchers at the gym before I bought these Inov-8 235 V3. The difference is dramatic during my workouts with the Inov-8, my feet feel like they are supported top, bottom and sides. I have wide feet and these fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BUF

customer_reviews.title: Fits Smaller Than Normal
customer_reviews.text: Almost every pair of shoe I buy I need a 10.5 (US), but these run smaller than expected. I would advise getting a half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: CFC #1

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Cross Training
customer_reviews.text: A snug fit around the mid foot provides stability and the wide toe section provides room to spread my toes while heavy lifting. Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Not the same sizing as Inov-8 Mens F-Lite 235 V2.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the usual size for my last two pairs of Inov-8 Mens F-Lite 235 V2 but these are painfully small. I cannot wear them. Definitely go up a half size.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the gym or court.
customer_reviews.text: I teach boot camp on a basketball court and do a variety of strength and conditioning exercises. These shoe provide great stability and support. Only drawback is they are heavier than my old pair.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great! They are tough, comfortable and look great. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Huckleby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe. Use them for Crossfit and lifting workouts. Snug fit with just enough cushion in the insole. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great for running and working out cross training
customer_reviews.text: I run and work out with these. They help prevent blisters.
customer_reviews.author: C. Freund

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoes
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is different than past inov8's. These are More snug.
customer_reviews.author: dan ilani

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe but to wide.
customer_reviews.text: To wide for me, love the look in pictures but blimey realize the width. Don’t have this problem with other shoes so not sure why?
customer_reviews.author: Andy Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great all around shoe
customer_reviews.text: Lift in them a few times a week and have done a few sprint/track workouts, so far no issues at all and seem to be the best pair of Inov-8’s I’ve worn. Would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Miller

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have low arches and need shoes with a wide toe box. This shoe is comfortable and has room in the toe box. Excellent shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workout shoes
customer_reviews.text: very practical and good quality workout shoes, fit as expected
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: These fit well and have the kind of support I needed. I like the very simple streamlined look and feel. I’ve always had good luck with inov8 shoes and these did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kurtenbach

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoe!
customer_reviews.text: They feel and look great. Like the v1 with a tad of padding.
customer_reviews.author: c p wojciechowski

customer_reviews.title: Great gym shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, works well for the gym and short runs
customer_reviews.author: silvestre

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First time trying inov....they fit perfect.. feel & look great..definitely buying another pair
customer_reviews.author: Eloy

customer_reviews.title: Never using a different shoe for squatting
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a great grip on your feet when squatting and leg pressing. They make your feet feel stable , very good shoe quality.
customer_reviews.author: JC Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best All Around shoe Ive ever worn. Definitely the most comfortable and best looking
customer_reviews.author: zizezy

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality shoes for CrossFit. I have a 4E wide foot, these come 2E. Hard to find the perfect fit, but quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: MIGUEL

customer_reviews.title: Flat feet = not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine, I have flat feet and they made my feet hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable Crossfit shoe I've owned in six years.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have better arch support for my foot than other shoes I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: TG72

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes for lifting
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes mostly for weight training. They are very comfortable for this task
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best sneaker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect fit, super comfortable and incredibly stylish......definitely a head turner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a dozen Inov-8 shoes in different styles and love the way they fit
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Shoes for the Land of the Free, the Home of the Brave, for Life, Liberty, and you know the thing...
customer_reviews.text: What more can you ask for? Seriously, these have been great and comfortable shoes for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great workout shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and stylish. I use them to workout and run. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Majewski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are so of the best training shoes I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Inov8 F-Lite 235 V3 Training Shoes - AW19
product_meta.description: Inov8 F-Lite 235 v3 Training Shoes The new look F-Lite 235 V3 is an all natural, lightweight and flexible training shoe designed around natural movement and upmost comfort. Inov8 Shoe Fit Scale For technical footwear, a good fit is essential to enhance your performance. Inov8's new Shoe Fit Scale makes it easier to find the perfect fitting shoe. All Inov8 shoes are designed with Met-Cradle technology to lock down the mid-foot for a stable hold, where they differ is in the toe box. The shoes are now graded from 1 to 5, Grade 1 representing their closest, most precise fit and Grade 5 representing the widest fitting toe box. The lower the number on the scale, the narrower the fit, which ensures minimal internal movement of the foot when running fast on technical terrain. Shoes with the higher numbers on the scale will suit athletes with a wider foot and those wanting that extra comfort in the toe box. This wider toe box allows the toes to splay for increased stability when lifting heavy weights. It's also perfect for longer runs and races when toes begin to swell. Inov8 have graded the F-Lite 235 v3 Training Shoes as Grade 5. Breathable Mesh Upper Constructed using a breathable mesh, the Inov8 F-Lite 235 v3 Training Shoes allow you to power through any workout. Perforations within the fabric allow cool air to circulate throughout the shoe creating a perfect microclimate for your feet to thrive in. As you build up heat in the gym, the breathable mesh forces out hot muggy air ensuring you remain cool, dry and comfortable at all times. Synthetic overlays also feature on the upper to ensure your feet are protected at all times. The durable overlays increase midfoot support and reduce the risks of wear and tear. An elastic mesh liner hugs the foot for added comfort and support. Completing is an external heel cage which ensures added stability around the heel so you remain support through the toughest workouts. POWERFLOW+ Midsole The midsole for the Inov8 F-Lite
feature_bullets: Durable Overlays - Increases structure and support.
Elastic Liner - Hugs the foot for comfortable wear.
External Heel Cage - Locks in the heel for supportive fit.
Powerflow+ - Delivers 10% better shock absorption and 25% better energy return.
